title: Crystals (dNetHack)
data:
- *For the [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials"), see either [glass](/wiki/Glass "Glass") or [gemstone](/wiki/Gemstone "Gemstone").*

The **Crystals** are a set of five [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [crystal balls](/wiki/Crystal_ball "Crystal ball") that appear in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), and are associated with the [Temple of Chaos variant](/wiki/Chaos_Temple_Quest "Chaos Temple Quest") of the [Chaos Quest](/wiki/Chaos_Quest_\(dNetHack\) "Chaos Quest (dNetHack)").

Four of the Crystals are found early on in the quest, but attempting to pick them up will cause them to evade a character's grasp and [blast](/wiki/Artifact_blast "Artifact blast") them - a Crystal can only be safely picked up once its guardian is defeated, rendering them useless if they appear in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") and the Chaos Quest in that game is a different variant.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Describe ndnh powers, strategy section for both variants."*

## Generation

The first four Crystals are unaligned and found embedded within the walls of the Ruined Temple, while The Black Crystal is generated in the possession of [Chaos](/wiki/Chaos "Chaos").

As [Chaos Quest artifacts](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Chaos_quest_artifacts "DNetHack artifacts"), all five Crystals cannot be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for since they are guaranteed to appear if you generate the Chaos Temple as your Chaos Quest branch; only the Black Crystal is counted towards the total number of artifacts generated in a game. Any of the Crystals can generate in bones files as mentioned above; if this occurs in a game with the Temple of Chaos as your Chaos Quest, the Crystals in question are replaced with normal crystal balls.

## Description

All five Crystals each have a [weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight") value different from the standard 50 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum") of a crystal ball in dNetHack and notdNetHack. Each Crystal also has an #[invoke](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") ability and an extrinsic [property](/wiki/Property "Property") that roughly matches their element; carrying each Crystal grants knowledge of a specific spell and provides bonuses to casting that spell, along with increasing the [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") cap for certain skills by one point.

In addition, carrying all five Crystals confers a single use of [life saving](/wiki/Life_saving "Life saving") that stacks with the life saving property of the Black Crystal - the life saving of all five Crystals is used first if possible, and the Black Crystal's life saving is used otherwise. The Black Crystal and the other four Crystals will appear as "cracked" to show that their life saving has been used up, though cracked Crystals otherwise function as normal.

### List of Crystals

| Name              | Color   |          | Guardian                                                                                      | Weight (aum) | Properties                                                                                                                                                                               | Invoke                                                                                                                                          | Spell                                                                                                                                                | Boosted skills                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ----------------- | ------- | -------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|                   | Initial | Purified |                                                                                               |              |                                                                                                                                                                                          |                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| The Earth Crystal | (       | (        | [Lich, the Fiend of Earth](/wiki/Lich,_the_Fiend_of_Earth "Lich, the Fiend of Earth") L       | 100          | [Half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage") when carried                                                                                                   | [Earthquake](/index.php?title=Earthquake\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Earthquake (page does not exist)")                                            | [dig](/wiki/Spellbook_of_dig "Spellbook of dig")                                                                                                     | [martial arts](/wiki/Martial_arts "Martial arts") upgrades [bare-handed combat](/wiki/Bare-handed_combat "Bare-handed combat") to martial arts [attack spells](/wiki/Attack_spells "Attack spells") [healing spells](/wiki/Healing_spells "Healing spells") [clerical spells](/wiki/Clerical_spells "Clerical spells") [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken") |
| The Fire Crystal  | (       | (        | [Kary, the Fiend of Fire](/wiki/Kary,_the_Fiend_of_Fire "Kary, the Fiend of Fire") &          | 10           | [Fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") when carried                                                                                                                  | Area-of-effect fire spell                                                                                                                       | [fireball](/wiki/Spellbook_of_fireball "Spellbook of fireball")                                                                                      | [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow") [wand damage](/index.php?title=Wand_damage\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Wand damage (page does not exist)") [matter spells](/wiki/Matter_spells "Matter spells") [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")                                                                                              |
| The Water Crystal | (       | (        | [Kraken, the Fiend of Water](/wiki/Kraken,_the_Fiend_of_Water "Kraken, the Fiend of Water") ; | 40           | [Cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance") when carried                                                                                                                  | Area-of-effect ice spell                                                                                                                        | [cone of cold](/wiki/Spellbook_of_cone_of_cold "Spellbook of cone of cold")                                                                          | [hammer](/wiki/Hammer "Hammer") [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword") [clerical spells](/wiki/Clerical_spells "Clerical spells") [musicalize spell](/wiki/Musicalize_spell "Musicalize spell")                                                                                                                            |
| The Air Crystal   | (       | (        | [Tiamat, the Fiend of Wind](/wiki/Tiamat,_the_Fiend_of_Wind "Tiamat, the Fiend of Wind") D    | 20           | [Shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance") when carried                                                                                                               | Area-of-effect shock spell                                                                                                                      | [lightning bolt](/index.php?title=Spellbook_of_lightning_bolt\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Spellbook of lightning bolt (page does not exist)")           | [bare-handed combat](/wiki/Bare-handed_combat "Bare-handed combat") [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe") [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber") [healing spells](/wiki/Healing_spells "Healing spells") [attack spells](/wiki/Attack_spells "Attack spells") [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")                                                                                         |
| The Black Crystal | (       | (        | [Chaos](/wiki/Chaos "Chaos") &                                                                | 30           | [Magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") and [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning") when carried, [life saving](/wiki/Life_saving "Life saving"), 2x damage when thrown | Area-of-effect 'death' spell (similar to breaking a [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death"), flavored as a "disintegration field") | [haste self](/wiki/Spellbook_of_haste_self "Spellbook of haste self") [extra healing](/wiki/Spellbook_of_extra_healing "Spellbook of extra healing") | [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword") [escape spells](/wiki/Escape_spells "Escape spells")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Crystals (dNetHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the object materials, see either glass or gemstone.

The Crystals are a set of five artifact crystal balls that appear in dNetHack and notdNetHack, and are associated with the Temple of Chaos variant of the Chaos Quest.

Four of the Crystals are found early on in the quest, but attempting to pick them up will cause them to evade a character's grasp and blast them - a Crystal can only be safely picked up once its guardian is defeated, rendering them useless if they appear in bones and the Chaos Quest in that game is a different variant.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Describe ndnh powers, strategy section for both variants."

Generation

The first four Crystals are unaligned and found embedded within the walls of the Ruined Temple, while The Black Crystal is generated in the possession of Chaos.

As Chaos Quest artifacts, all five Crystals cannot be wished for since they are guaranteed to appear if you generate the Chaos Temple as your Chaos Quest branch; only the Black Crystal is counted towards the total number of artifacts generated in a game. Any of the Crystals can generate in bones files as mentioned above; if this occurs in a game with the Temple of Chaos as your Chaos Quest, the Crystals in question are replaced with normal crystal balls.

Description

All five Crystals each have a weight value different from the standard 50 aum of a crystal ball in dNetHack and notdNetHack. Each Crystal also has an #invoke ability and an extrinsic property that roughly matches their element; carrying each Crystal grants knowledge of a specific spell and provides bonuses to casting that spell, along with increasing the skill cap for certain skills by one point.

In addition, carrying all five Crystals confers a single use of life saving that stacks with the life saving property of the Black Crystal - the life saving of all five Crystals is used first if possible, and the Black Crystal's life saving is used otherwise. The Black Crystal and the other four Crystals will appear as "cracked" to show that their life saving has been used up, though cracked Crystals otherwise function as normal.
